description: Common resume and career Q&A for RAG. Used together with resume-full.json when the user clicks Ask.

qa.question: Walk me through your resume. Tell me about yourself.
qa.answer: Joseph Beyer is a senior software engineer with 30+ years of experience in web development, IT, and communication. He is currently a contractor at Hi Marine Company (remote), building Angular applications with Material Design and MarineTraffic.com API integration. Before that he spent over 11 years at the U.S. Dept. of Transportation as a senior software engineer and subcontractor, working on projects for UK Ministry of Defence, US Air Mobility Command, NHTSA Crash Data Acquisition Network (CDAN), and Police Accident Reports (PARs) automation. His background includes roles at The CCS Companies, John Hancock Financial, Virtual Research Associates, Fidelity, and earlier positions at Gillette, Phase Forward, and others. He holds an M.S. in Scientific Computing from UMass Lowell (3.6 GPA) and a B.A. in Mathematics from Boston University (Dean's List). He is proficient in Angular, JavaScript, TypeScript, C#, and many Microsoft and web technologies, and his next great challenge is becoming proficient coding with artificial intelligence (AI).

qa.question: How many years of experience do you have? How long have you been in software?
qa.answer: Joseph has 30+ years of professional experience in web development, IT, and communication. He has worked in fast-paced and diverse environments including startups, blue-chip companies, and government, and has successfully delivered solutions across that entire span.

qa.question: What are your key strengths? Greatest strengths?
qa.answer: Joseph's key strengths include: excellent planning, communication, and interpersonal skills; strong ability to manage multiple tasks and adapt to changing needs; and a proven track record of delivering solutions in fast-paced, diverse environments. He is also proficient in web technologies (Angular, JavaScript, TypeScript, etc.) and software development tools (Visual Studio, VSCode/Cursor, Git).

qa.question: What are your technical skills? What technologies do you know?
qa.answer: Joseph's technical skills include: Angular v1.9/AngularJS, JavaScript, jQuery, TypeScript, C#, HTML, CSS, T-SQL, VB.NET/VBScript/VBA, ASP/ASP.NET Web API/RESTful services, Material Design, UI Path, Git, and Azure. He uses many web development tools, Visual Studio, VSCode, Team Foundation Server (TFS), SQL Server, and is proficient in numerous Microsoft and Windows products.

qa.question: What is your education? Where did you go to school? What degree do you have?
qa.answer: Joseph holds a Master of Science in Scientific Computing from the University of Massachusetts at Lowell (January 1993), graduating with a 3.6/4.0 GPA. He also has a Bachelor of Arts in Mathematics from Boston University (June 1991), where he was on the Dean's List from 1990 to 1991.

qa.question: What is your current role? What do you do now? Current job?
qa.answer: Joseph is currently a contractor at Hi Marine Company (remote), where he develops a web-based Angular application with Material Design components, integrating the MarineTraffic.com API so users can manage ships and fleets. He uses Angular v1.9, TypeScript, Material Design, JavaScript, and GitHub.

qa.question: What is your next great challenge? Career goals? What do you want to do next?
qa.answer: Joseph's next great challenge is becoming proficient at coding using artificial intelligence (AI). He is focused on growing in that area while continuing to deliver strong results in web and software development.

qa.question: What certifications do you have? Microsoft certifications?
qa.answer: Joseph holds Microsoft Certified Professional 2.0 (MCP), Microsoft Certified Application Developer (MCAD), Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS), and Microsoft Certified Professional Developer (MCPD). He has passed Microsoft exams 70-315, 70-316, 70-320, 70-528, 70-536, and 70-547. He also completed training in Long Term Care Insurance (LTC Basics, Financing Long-Term Care Needs, and Product/Policy Design, Pricing, and Regulation).

qa.question: Do you have experience with Angular? TypeScript? C#? JavaScript?
qa.answer: Yes. Joseph has extensive experience with Angular (v1.9/AngularJS), TypeScript, JavaScript, jQuery, and C#. He has used them at Hi Marine (Angular, TypeScript, Material Design, JavaScript), at U.S. Dept. of Transportation (Angular v1.8, TypeScript, JavaScript, C#), and in earlier roles. He also uses VB.NET, ASP.NET, T-SQL, Git, Azure DevOps, and many related tools.

qa.question: Where have you worked? Work history? Previous employers?
qa.answer: Joseph has worked at: Hi Marine Company (2025–present), U.S. Dept. of Transportation (2013–2025), The CCS Companies (2009–2013), John Hancock Financial (2005–2009), Virtual Research Associates (2007/2008), OneSource, Fidelity Investments, Surebridge, Systems Engineering Inc., Optasite, Cahners/eLogic, Phase Forward, The Gillette Company, The Boston Globe, Boston College High School, and Process Design Sciences. He has experience in government, finance, insurance, defense, and product companies.

qa.question: What did you do at the U.S. Dept of Transportation? DOT experience?
qa.answer: At the U.S. Dept. of Transportation (October 2013 – January 2025) Joseph worked as a senior software engineer and subcontractor. He developed applications for the UK Ministry of Defence (defense data), US Air Mobility Command (cargo data reading, parsing, storage), NHTSA Crash Data Acquisition Network (CDAN) and the Crash Investigation Sampling System (CISS), and built UI Path applications to download, scan, and process Police Accident Reports (PARs). He used Angular v1.8, TypeScript, JavaScript, C#, Visual Studio, UI Path, Git, and Azure DevOps.

qa.question: What are your hobbies? Interests outside work?
qa.answer: Joseph's hobbies include astronomy, speed chess with friends and family, former (multi-)marathon running, and pickleball.

qa.answer: Joseph can be reached by email at Joe@bcjj.com, by phone at 978.273.0215, and on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/joseph-beyer-6148171. He is based in the Boston Area, MA.

qa.answer: Joseph's resume does not include his age or birth date. He prefers to let his 30+ years of professional experience and his current work (including AI-focused development) speak to his expertise. You can ask about his experience, skills, education, or career goals instead.

He coded mathematical and actuarial models to generate and present Long Term Care insurance rates, using C#, VB6/VB.NET, ASP.NET, ADO.NET, Adobe PDF, web services, T-SQL/SQL Server, Visual Studio, Data Dynamics ActiveReports, CSS, XML, Active-X, and COM.

He developed a web-based data collection application that collects data for NHTSA's Crash Data Acquisition Network. The new Crash Investigation Sampling System (CISS) can replace the National Automotive Sampling System (NASS).
